thread.title: Crystal Palace fans vandalise their OWN coach after mistaking it for Middlesbrough’s
thread.title_full: Crystal Palace fans vandalise their OWN coach after mistaking it for Middlesbrough’s

author: ituckey
title: Crystal Palace fans vandalise their OWN coach after mistaking it for Middlesbrough’s
text:
Comments CRYSTAL PALACE fans scored a massive own goal by vandalising their OWN team’s coach. 
Palace ’s bus was parked at a hotel near Selhurst Park on Friday night and supporters covered it in spray paint, mistakenly thinking it belonged to opponents Middlesbrough . 3 Eagles supporters attacked their own coach and reportedly caused £40k damage 
The hotel is where visiting teams often stay in the area. And it is thought the Eagles players were actually staying there. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Crystal Palace gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Palace’s assistant head groundsman, Dean Waters, tweeted: “£40,000 worth of damage on our coach thinking it was the Boro coach. Nice one! #cpfc” 
Waters changed his Twitter settings to hide the message shortly afterwards but it was too late to keep the story from coming out. 
An Eagles spokesman said: “The team bus was covered in graffiti with the words ‘Crystal Palace’ overnight on Friday ahead of the game on Saturday. Police have been informed.” Palace fans have cost their own club dear with the vandalism of the team coach PA:Press Association Sam Allardyce still had reason to celebrate, beating Boro to move out of drop zone Crystal Palace 1-0 Middlesbrough : Only second win in nine games for Big Sam
